results.title: Very good friends
results.creator_credit: Richard Bennett, Martin Tahse, Learning Corporation of America and Martin Tahse Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Learning to be human”.
Based on the novel “Beat the Turtle Drum” by Constance Greene. Deals with a thirteen-year-old girl’s reactions to the death of her younger sister, to whom she was very close. Starring Melissa Sue Anderson, Katy Kurtzman.

results.title: Schoolboy father
results.creator_credit: Arthur Allan Seidelman, Martin Tahse and Martin Tahse Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Learning to be human”.
Adaptation of the book “He’s my baby now” by Jeanette Eyerly, which focuses on a 16-year-old boy and his dilemma after learning that he has fathered a child. Determined to fill the parental void for his child, he finds himself confronting some harsh realities. Stars Rob Lowe and Dana Plato.

results.title: Skating rink
results.creator_credit: Larry S. Elikann, Martin Tahse and Martin Tahse Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Learning to be human”.
Tells the story of a teenage boy whose stammering and difficulty in communicating his feelings and thoughts were brought on by the death of his mother when he was a small boy. Shows how he develops confidence and a sense of achievement through learning to skate well and through his asociation with the couple who teach him to skate. Based on a novel by Mildred Lee. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Larry S. Elikann, Martin Tahse and Martin Tahse Productions

results.title: Someone's in the kitchen with Jamie
results.creator_credit: Barra Grant, Elaine Sperber and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Learning to be human”.
Relates to an adolescent boy’s struggle to remain a “boy” in the eyes of his basketball coach and team-mates, while he is undertaking a Home Economics course. Cast includes Don Kehr, Dixie Carter, William Russ.

results.title: Make believe marriage
results.creator_credit: Robert Fuest, Evelyn Barron, Highgate Pictures and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Learning to be human”.
Follows the progress of a group of senior high school students who undertake a marriage course lasting one semester. After being arbitrarily assigned a marriage partner, the couples are required to work out a suitable budget, undertake shopping trips to price basic items and generally come to terms with differing likes and dislikes. Each “family” must also meet a crisis: a baby, a loss of job, or a prison term for theft. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Kings and scribes
results.creator_credit: Peter Spry-Leverton and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Ancient lives”.
John Romer goes in search of the lost tomb of Herihor, emulating Howard Carter and his discovery of Tut’s tomb. He looks at the role of the scribe and in particular one man who collected the ancient coffins of pharoahs whose tombs had been plundered, and reburied them in order to safeguard them. When the plundered tombs were discovered, the Egyptians of the day, sang the funerary songs of their ancient counterparts as the pharoahs and their sarcophagi were taken down the Nile to a final resting place in the Musuem. The program also highlights recent archaeological investigations in the Valley of the Kings.

results.title: Community life, women and the Temple of Karnak
results.creator_credit: Peter Spry-Leverton and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Ancient lives”.
John Romer focuses on the role of women in ancient Egypt and their rituals such as birthing practices as well as reading some Egyptian love poetry. Romer explains the mathematical perfection of the Great Temple of Karnak, and provides an insight into the workings of the village oracle, the supernatural and medical treatment.

results.title: Ancient gold mines and temples
results.creator_credit: Peter Spry-Leverton and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Ancient lives”.
John Romer details the life of Paneb, one of the most extraordinary men who lived in the village of Deir El medina; village of the Royal Tomb makers. He also examines the famed erotic papyrus of Turin, visits the ancient gold mines where criminals were sentenced to a life of hard labour in the most inhumane conditions and tours the great temple of Medinet Habu.

results.title: The Royal tombs
results.creator_credit: Peter Spry-Leverton and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Ancient lives”.
The villagers of Deir El Medina, just outside Thebes, was the home of the Royal Tomb builders and painters of ancient Egypt. John Romer, British archaeologist explains how the villagers’ lives fitted into the highly organised Egyptian society. He explores the tombs in the Valley of the Kings and explains how the beautiful wall paintings and carved reliefs were executed and their changed design over time. The program visits Tutankhamun’s tomb, the temple of Deir El Medina, the village tomb of Ipy and the tombs of Kha in Turin.
